This is the character string generator.

Constructor Detail

CharStringGenerator

public CharStringGenerator(boolean[] B,
                           int len,
                           boolean u)
This is the CharStringGenerator's constructor

Parameters:
B - This is an array of boolean values that designate what types of characters should be in the character string. True designates that the value type should be used. Array[0] = Numerical (0-9) Array[1] = Uppercase (A-Z) Array[2] = Lowercase (a-z)
len - This integer is the required length of the character string.
u - This boolean value denotes if the random values generated should be unique.
Method Detail

prepareGenerator

public void prepareGenerator(java.sql.Connection c)
This is used to prepare the generator, creating required tables in the database, loading required data into memory, and handling any other dependencies.

Parameters:
c - This is the connection object to the database that the generator will use.

destroyGenerator

public void destroyGenerator()
This performs cleanup operations, deleting temporary tables and indices.

nextTuple

public java.lang.String nextTuple()
This method returns a random character string that meets the generator's specifications.

Returns:
This String contains random characters that meet the generator's criteria.
